oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Correspondence: President Andrew Johnson to Governor William Gannaway Brownlow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Transcription of an official telegraphic dispatch between President Andrew Johnson and Gov. William G. Brownlow of Tennessee, dated July 10, 1865, advising on laws recently passed by the Tennessee General Assembly, a fair election for Members of Congress representing Tennessee, and the offer of military aid to sustain civil authority in the State.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, Andrew (1808-1875)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Brownlow, William Gannaway (1805-1877); Reconstruction (U.S. History, 1865-1877)
